intro: Hypseocharis, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions of countries like Ecuador and Peru. Hypseocharis species are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue or violet in color. They often grow in high-altitude environments, adapting to the cooler and more rugged conditions of mountainous terrain. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and ecological adaptations.
